fields.name: clsID
fields.description: Class ID of the Acknowledged Message

fields.name: msgID
fields.description: Message ID of the Acknowledged Message

fields.name: clsID
fields.description: Class ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

fields.name: msgID
fields.description: Message ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

fields.name: svid
fields.description: SV ID for which this Almanac Data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32 or 51, 56, 63).

fields.name: week
fields.description: Issue Date of Almanac (GPS week number)

variable.formula: 8 bytes for basic fields, 96 additional bytes if optional block present

fields.name: svid
fields.description: SV ID for which this ephemeris data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32).

fields.name: how
fields.description: Hand-Over Word of first Subframe. This is required if data is sent to the receiver. 0 indicates that no Ephemeris Data is following.

messages.name: UBX-AID-HUI
messages.description: GPS health, UTC and ionosphere parameters

fields.name: health
fields.description: Bitmask, every bit represent a GPS SV (1-32). If the bit is set the SV is healthy.

fields.name: utcLS
fields.description: UTC - time difference due to leap seconds before event

fields.name: utcWNF
fields.description: UTC - week number when next leap second event occurs

fields.name: utcDN
fields.description: UTC - day of week when next leap second event occurs

fields.name: utcLSF
fields.description: UTC - time difference due to leap seconds after event

fields.name: utcSpare
fields.description: UTC - Spare to ensure structure is a multiple of 4 bytes

bits.name: healthValid
bits.description: Healthmask field in this message is valid

bits.name: utcValid
bits.description: UTC parameter fields in this message are valid

bits.name: klobValid
bits.description: Klobuchar parameter fields in this message are valid

messages.name: UBX-AID-INI
messages.description: Aiding position, time, frequency, clock drift

fields.name: ecefXOrLat
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate or latitude, depending on flags below

fields.name: ecefYOrLon
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate or longitude, depending on flags below

fields.name: ecefZOrAlt
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate or altitude, depending on flags below

fields.name: wnoOrDate
fields.description: Actual week number or yearSince2000/Month (YYMM), depending on flags below

fields.name: towOrTime
fields.description: Actual time of week or DayOfMonth/Hour/Minute/Second (DDHHMMMSS), depending on flags below

fields.name: towNs
fields.description: Fractional part of time of week

fields.name: clkDOrFreq
fields.description: Clock drift or frequency, depending on flags below

fields.name: clkDAccOrFreqAcc
fields.description: Accuracy of clock drift or frequency, depending on flags below

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Bitmask with the following flags (see graphic below)

bits.name: clockD
bits.description: Clock drift data contains valid clock drift, must not be set together with clockF

bits.name: clockF
bits.description: Clock drift data contains valid frequency, must not be set together with clockD

bits.name: lla
bits.description: Position is given in lat/long/alt (default is ECEF)

bits.name: altInv
bits.description: Altitude is not valid, if lla was set

bits.name: prevTm
bits.description: Use time mark received before AID-INI message (default uses mark received after message)

bits.name: utc
bits.description: Time is given as UTC date/time (default is GPS wno/tow)

bits.name: svcs
bits.description: Enable antenna supply voltage control signal

bits.name: pdwnOnSCD
bits.description: Power down antenna supply if short circuit is detected. (only in combination with bit 1)

bits.name: recovery
bits.description: Enable automatic recovery from short state

bits.name: pinSwitch
bits.description: PIO-pin used for switching antenna supply

bits.name: pinSCD
bits.description: PIO-pin used for detecting a short in the antenna supply

bits.name: pinOCD
bits.description: PIO-pin used for detecting open/not connected antenna

bits.name: reconfig
bits.description: If set to one, and this command is sent to the receiver, the receiver will reconfigure the pins as specified.

fields.name: bufSize
fields.description: Size of buffer in number of epochs to store

fields.name: notifThrs
fields.description: Buffer fill level that triggers PIO notification, in number of epochs stored

fields.name: pioId
fields.description: PIO ID to use for buffer level notification

fields.name: clearMask
fields.description: Mask with configuration sub-sections to clear (i.e. load default configurations to permanent configurations in non-volatile memory)

fields.name: saveMask
fields.description: Mask with configuration sub-sections to save (i.e. save current configurations to non-volatile memory)

fields.name: loadMask
fields.description: Mask with configuration sub-sections to load (i.e. load permanent configurations from non-volatile memory to current configurations)

fields.name: deviceMask
fields.description: Mask which selects the memory devices for this command

variable.formula: 0 for poll, 44 for set, 52 for get

values.name: user
values.description: user-defined (extra values are defined for protocol versions less than 13.00)

fields.name: majA
fields.description: Semi-major axis ( accepted range = 6,300,000 to 6,500,000.0 meters ).

fields.name: dX
fields.description: X axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

fields.name: dY
fields.description: Y axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

fields.name: dZ
fields.description: Z axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

fields.name: rotX
fields.description: Rotation about the X axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

fields.name: rotY
fields.description: Rotation about the Y axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

fields.name: rotZ
fields.description: Rotation about the Z axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Scale change ( accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million ).

variable.formula: 0 for poll request, 44 for set, 52 for get response

values.name: user
values.description: user-defined (extra values are defined for protocol versions less than 13.00)

fields.name: dX
fields.description: X axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: dY
fields.description: Y axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: dZ
fields.description: Z axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: rotX
fields.description: Rotation about the X axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: rotY
fields.description: Rotation about the Y axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: rotZ
fields.description: Rotation about the Z axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Scale change (accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million)

values.name: user
values.description: user-defined (extra values are defined for protocol versions less than 13.00)

fields.name: dX
fields.description: X axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: dY
fields.description: Y axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: dZ
fields.description: Z axis shift at the origin (accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters)

fields.name: rotX
fields.description: Rotation about the X axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: rotY
fields.description: Rotation about the Y axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: rotZ
fields.description: Rotation about the Z axis (accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds)

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Scale change (accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million)

fields.name: dgnssMode
fields.description: Specifies differential mode: 2: RTK float: No attempts are made to fix ambiguities. 3: RTK fixed: Ambiguities are fixed whenever possible.

values.name: rtk_float
values.description: RTK float: No attempts are made to fix ambiguities

values.name: rtk_fixed
values.description: RTK fixed: Ambiguities are fixed whenever possible

fields.name: numOsc
fields.description: Number of oscillators to configure (affects length of this message)

repeated_groups.name: oscillator_config
repeated_groups.description: Oscillator configuration repeated for each oscillator

fields.name: oscId
fields.description:
Id of oscillator.
0 - internal oscillator
1 - external oscillator

bits.name: isCalibrated
bits.description: If the oscillator gain is calibrated, 0 if not

fields.name: phaseOffset
fields.description: Intended phase offset of the oscillator relative to the leading edge of the time pulse

fields.name: withTemp
fields.description: Oscillator stability limit over operating temperature range (must be > 0)

fields.name: timeToTemp
fields.description: The minimum time that it could take for a temperature variation to move the oscillator frequency by 'withTemp' (must be > 0)

fields.name: gainVco
fields.description: Oscillator control gain/slope; change of frequency per unit change in raw control change

fields.name: gainUncertainty
fields.description: Relative uncertainty (1 standard deviation) of oscillator control gain/slope

bits.name: doAutoMntAlg
bits.description: Enable/disable automatic IMU-mount alignment (0: Disabled, 1: Enabled). This flag can only be used with modules containing an internal IMU.

fields.name: yaw
fields.description: User-defined IMU-mount yaw angle [0, 36000], e.g. for 60.00 degree yaw angle the configured value would be 6000

fields.name: pitch
fields.description: User-defined IMU-mount pitch angle [-9000, 9000], e.g. for 60.00 degree pitch angle the configured value would be 6000

fields.name: roll
fields.description: User-defined IMU-mount roll angle [-18000, 18000], e.g. for 60.00 degree roll angle the configured value would be 6000

fields.name: accelRmsThd1
fields.description: Accelerometer RMS threshold below which automatically estimated accelerometer noise-level (accuracy) is updated.

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: Nominal accelerometer sensor data sampling frequency.

fields.name: latency
fields.description: Accelerometer sensor data latency due to e.g. CAN bus.

fields.name: tcTableSaveRate
fields.description: Temperature-dependent gyroscope bias table saving update rate.

fields.name: gyroRmsThd1
fields.description: Gyroscope sensor RMS noise threshold below which automatically estimated gyroscope noise-level (accuracy) is updated.

fields.name: frequency
fields.description: Nominal gyroscope sensor data sampling frequency.

fields.name: latency
fields.description: Gyroscope sensor data latency due to e.g. CAN bus.

bits.name: combineTicks
bits.description: Use combined rear wheel-ticks instead of the single tick

bits.name: useWtSpeed
bits.description: Use speed measurements (data type 11 in ESF-MEAS) instead of single ticks (data type 10)

bits.name: dirPinPol
bits.description: Direction pin polarity - 0: High signal level means forward direction, 1: High signal level means backward direction

bits.name: useWtPin
bits.description: Use wheel-tick pin for speed measurement

bits.name: autoWtCountMaxOff
bits.description: Disable automatic estimation of maximum absolute wheel-tick counter value

bits.name: autoDirPinPolOff
bits.description: Disable automatic wheel-tick direction pin polarity detection

bits.name: autoSoftwareWtOff
bits.description: Disable automatic use of wheel-tick or speed data received over the software interface if available

bits.name: autoUseWtSpeedOff
bits.description: Disable automatic receiver reconfiguration for processing speed data instead of wheel-tick data if no wheel-tick data are available but speed data were detected

fields.name: wtFactor
fields.description: Wheel-tick scale factor to obtain distance [m] from wheel-ticks (0 = not set)

fields.name: wtQuantError
fields.description: Wheel-tick quantization. If useWtSpeed is set then this is interpreted as the speed measurement error RMS.

fields.name: wtCountMax
fields.description: Wheel-tick counter maximum value (rollover - 1). If null, relative wheel-tick counts are assumed (and therefore no rollover). If not null, absolute wheel-tick counts are assumed and the value corresponds to the highest tick count value before rollover happens.

fields.name: wtLatency
fields.description: Wheel-tick data latency due to e.g. CAN bus

fields.name: wtFrequency
fields.description: Nominal wheel-tick data frequency (0 = not set)

bits.name: cntBothEdges
bits.description: Count both rising and falling edges on wheel-tick signal (only relevant if wheel-tick is measured by the u-blox receiver)

fields.name: speedDeadBand
fields.description: Speed sensor dead band (0 = not set)

fields.name: numSources
fields.description: Number of sources (affects length of this message)

fields.name: extInt
fields.description: EXTINT index of this source (0 for EXTINT0 and 1 for EXTINT1)

fields.name: sourceType
fields.description: Source type: 0: none, 1: frequency source, 2: time source, 3: feedback from external oscillator

bits.name: polarity
bits.description: Polarity of signal: 0: leading edge is rising edge, 1: leading edge is falling edge

bits.name: gnssUtc
bits.description: Time base of timing signal: 0: GNSS - as specified in CFG-TP5 (or GPS if CFG-TP5 indicates UTC), 1: UTC

fields.name: withTemp
fields.description: Oscillator stability limit over operating temperature range (must be > 0). Only used if sourceType is 1.

fields.name: withAge
fields.description: Oscillator stability with age (must be > 0). Only used if sourceType is 1.

fields.name: timeToTemp
fields.description: The minimum time that it could take for a temperature variation to move the oscillator frequency by 'withTemp' (must be > 0). Only used if sourceType is 1.

fields.name: maxDevLifeTime
fields.description: Maximum frequency deviation during lifetime (must be > 0). Only used if sourceType is 1.

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Phase offset of signal. Only used if sourceType is 2.

fields.name: offsetUncertainty
fields.description: Uncertainty of phase offset (one standard deviation). Only used if sourceType is 2.

fields.name: jitter
fields.description: Phase jitter (must be > 0). Only used if sourceType is 2.

fields.name: numFences
fields.description: Number of geofences contained in this message. Note that the receiver can only store a limited number of geofences (currently 4).

fields.name: confLvl
fields.description: Required confidence level for state evaluation. This value times the position's standard deviation (sigma) defines the confidence band. 0 = no confidence required, 1 = 68%, 2 = 95%, 3 = 99.7%, 4 = 99.99%

fields.name: pioEnabled
fields.description: 1 = Enable PIO combined fence state output, 0 = disable

values.name: disabled
values.description: Disable PIO combined fence state output

values.name: enabled
values.description: Enable PIO combined fence state output

fields.name: pinPolarity
fields.description: PIO pin polarity. 0 = Low means inside, 1 = Low means outside. Unknown state is always high.

values.name: low_outside
values.description: Pin Low means outside. Unknown state is always Pin High

fields.name: lat
fields.description: Latitude of the geofence circle center

fields.name: lon
fields.description: Longitude of the geofence circle center

fields.name: numTrkChHw
fields.description: Number of tracking channels available in hardware (read only)

fields.name: numTrkChUse
fields.description: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Number of tracking channels to use. Must be > 0, <= numTrkChHw. If 0xFF, then number of tracking channels to use will be set to numTrkChHw.

repeated_groups.name: configBlocks
repeated_groups.description: Configuration blocks for each GNSS system

fields.name: resTrkCh
fields.description: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Number of reserved (minimum) tracking channels for this system.

fields.name: maxTrkCh
fields.description: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Maximum number of tracking channels used for this system. Must be > 0, >= resTrkChn, <= numTrkChUse and <= maximum number of tracking channels supported for this system.

fields.name: flags
fields.description: Bitfield of flags. At least one signal must be configured in every enabled system.

fields.name: protocolID
fields.description: Protocol identifier, identifying for which protocol the configuration is set/get. The following are valid protocol identifiers: 0: UBX protocol, 1: NMEA protocol, 2-255: Reserved

fields.name: infMsgMask
fields.description: A bit mask, saying which information messages are enabled on each I/O port

bits.name: algorithmBits
bits.description: Reserved algorithm settings - should be set to 0x16B156 in hex for correct settings

bits.name: generalBits
bits.description: General settings - should be set to 0x31E in hex for correct setting

bits.name: enable2
bits.description: Set to 1 to scan auxiliary bands (u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 only, otherwise ignored)

bits.name: psmOncePerWakeupEnabled
bits.description: 1 = enable recording only one single position per PSM on/off mode wake-up period, 0 = disable once per wake-up

bits.name: applyAllFilterSettings
bits.description: 1 = apply all filter settings, 0 = only apply recordEnabled

fields.name: minInterval
fields.description: Minimum time interval between logged positions (0 = not set). This is only applied in combination with the speed and/or position thresholds. If both minInterval and timeThreshold are set, minInterval must be less than or equal to timeThreshold.

fields.name: timeThreshold
fields.description: If the time difference is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set).

fields.name: speedThreshold
fields.description: If the current speed is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set). minInterval also applies.

fields.name: positionThreshold
fields.description: If the 3D position difference is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set). minInterval also applies.

fields.name: mask
fields.description: Parameters bitmask. Only the masked parameters will be applied.

fields.name: dynModel
fields.description: Dynamic platform model: 0: portable, 2: stationary, 3: pedestrian, 4: automotive, 5: sea, 6: airborne with <1g acceleration, 7: airborne with <2g acceleration, 8: airborne with <4g acceleration, 9: wrist-worn watch, 10: motorbike, 11: robotic lawn mower, 12: electric kick scooter

values.name: wrist
values.description: wrist-worn watch (not supported for protocol versions less than 18.00)

values.name: mower
values.description: robotic lawn mower (supported for protocol versions 33.21+)

values.name: escooter
values.description: electric kick scooter (supported for protocol versions 33.21+)

fields.name: fixMode
fields.description: Position fixing mode: 1: 2D only, 2: 3D only, 3: auto 2D/3D

fields.name: fixedAlt
fields.description: Fixed altitude (mean sea level) for 2D fix mode

fields.name: minElev
fields.description: Minimum elevation for a GNSS satellite to be used in NAV

fields.name: cnoThreshNumSVs
fields.description: Number of satellites required to have C/NO above cnoThresh for a fix to be attempted

fields.name: cnoThresh
fields.description: C/NO threshold for deciding whether to attempt a fix

fields.name: staticHoldMaxDist
fields.description: Static hold distance threshold (before quitting static hold)

fields.name: utcStandard
fields.description: UTC standard to be used: 0: Automatic; receiver selects based on GNSS configuration, 3: UTC as operated by the U.S. Naval Observatory (USNO), 5: UTC as combined from multiple European laboratories, 6: UTC as operated by the former Soviet Union (SU), 7: UTC as operated by the National Time Service Center (NTSC), China, 8: UTC as operated by the National Physics Laboratory, India (NPLI)

values.name: auto
values.description: Automatic; receiver selects based on GNSS configuration

values.name: utc_gps
values.description: UTC as operated by the U.S. Naval Observatory (USNO); derived from GPS time

values.name: utc_galileo
values.description: UTC as combined from multiple European laboratories; derived from Galileo time

values.name: utc_glonass
values.description: UTC as operated by the former Soviet Union (SU); derived from GLONASS time

values.name: utc_ntsc
values.description: UTC as operated by the National Time Service Center (NTSC)

fields.name: mask1
fields.description: First parameters bitmask. Only the flagged parameters will be applied, unused bits must be set to 0.

bits.name: aop
bits.description: 1 = apply aopCfg (useAOP flag) and aopOrbMaxErr settings (AssistNow Autonomous)

fields.name: mask2
fields.description: Second parameters bitmask. Only the flagged parameters will be applied, unused bits must be set to 0.

bits.name: adr
bits.description: Apply ADR sensor fusion on/off setting (useAdr flag)

fields.name: minSVs
fields.description: Minimum number of satellites for navigation

fields.name: maxSVs
fields.description: Maximum number of satellites for navigation

fields.name: minCNO
fields.description: Minimum satellite signal level for navigation

fields.name: ackAiding
fields.description: 1 = issue acknowledgements for assistance message input

values.name: no_ack
values.description: Do not issue acknowledgements for assistance message input

values.name: ack
values.description: Issue acknowledgements for assistance message input

fields.name: wknRollover
fields.description: GPS week rollover number; GPS week numbers will be set correctly from this week up to 1024 weeks after this week. Setting this to 0 reverts to firmware default.

fields.name: sigAttenCompMode
fields.description: Only supported on certain products. Permanently attenuated signal compensation (0 = disabled, 255 = automatic, 1..63 = maximum expected C/NO value)

fields.name: usePPP
fields.description: 1 = use Precise Point Positioning (only available with the PPP product variant)

values.name: disabled
values.description: Do not use Precise Point Positioning

values.name: enabled
values.description: Use Precise Point Positioning (PPP product variant only)

fields.name: aopOrbMaxErr
fields.description: Maximum acceptable (modeled) AssistNow Autonomous orbit error (valid range = 5..1000, or 0 = reset to firmware default)

fields.name: useAdr
fields.description: Only supported on certain products. Enable/disable ADR sensor fusion (if 0: sensor fusion is disabled - if 1: sensor fusion is enabled).

bits.name: posFilt
bits.description: Enable position output for failed or invalid fixes

bits.name: mskPosFilt
bits.description: Enable position output for invalid fixes

bits.name: timeFilt
bits.description: Enable time output for invalid times

bits.name: dateFilt
bits.description: Enable date output for invalid dates

bits.name: gpsOnlyFilter
bits.description: Restrict output to GPS satellites only

bits.name: trackFilt
bits.description: Enable COG output even if COG is frozen

fields.name: nmeaVersion
fields.description: NMEA version (0x23: NMEA version 2.3, 0x21: NMEA version 2.1)

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Maximum number of SVs to report per TalkerId. 0: unlimited, 8: 8 SVs, 12: 12 SVs, 16: 16 SVs

fields.name: gnssToFilter
fields.description: Filters out satellites based on their GNSS. If a bitfield is enabled, the corresponding satellites will be not output.

fields.name: svNumbering
fields.description: Configures the display of satellites that do not have an NMEA-defined value. 0: Strict - Satellites are not output, 1: Extended - Use proprietary numbering

fields.name: mainTalkerId
fields.description: By default the main Talker ID (i.e. the Talker ID used for all messages other than GSV) is determined by the GNSS assignment of the receiver's channels. This field enables the main Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Main Talker ID is not overridden, 1: Set main Talker ID to 'GP', 2: Set main Talker ID to 'GL', 3: Set main Talker ID to 'GN', 4: Set main Talker ID to 'GA', 5: Set main Talker ID to 'GB', 6: Set main Talker ID to 'GQ'

values.name: default
values.description: Main Talker ID is not overridden

fields.name: gsvTalkerId
fields.description: By default the Talker ID for GSV messages is GNSS-specific (as defined by NMEA). This field enables the GSV Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA), 1: Use the main Talker ID

values.name: gnss
values.description: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA)

fields.name: cogMaxSpeed
fields.description: Speed below which course-over-ground (COG) is computed with the low-speed COG filter

fields.name: cogMaxPosAcc
fields.description: Maximum acceptable position accuracy for computing COG with the low-speed COG filter

fields.name: cogLpGain
fields.description: COG low-pass filter level (at speed < 8 m/s), range 0..255

fields.name: maxStartupStateDur
fields.description: Maximum time to spend in Acquisition state. If 0: bound disabled

bits.name: waitTimeFix
bits.description: Wait for Timefix (0 wait for normal fix OK, 1 wait for time fix OK)

bits.name: updateRTC
bits.description: Update Real Time Clock (0 do not wake up, 1 update RTC)

bits.name: updateEPH
bits.description: Update Ephemeris (0 do not wake up, 1 update Ephemeris)

bits.name: doNotEnterOff
bits.description: Behavior of receiver in case of no fix (0 receiver enters Inactive state, 1 receiver does not enter Inactive state)

bits.name: mode
bits.description: Mode of operation (00 ON/OFF operation, 01 cyclic tracking operation)

fields.name: updatePeriod
fields.description: Position update period. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a fix and it will wait for external events

fields.name: searchPeriod
fields.description: Acquisition retry period if previously failed. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a startup

fields.name: gridOffset
fields.description: Grid offset relative to GPS start of week

fields.name: onTime
fields.description: Time to stay in Tracking state

fields.name: extintInactivityMs
fields.description: inactivity time out on EXTINT pin if enabled

fields.name: powerSetupValue
fields.description:
Power setup value
0x00 = Full power
0x01 = Balanced
0x02 = Interval
0x03 = Aggressive with 1 Hz
0x04 = Aggressive with 2 Hz
0x05 = Aggressive with 4 Hz
0xFF = Invalid (only when polling)

values.name: aggressive_4_hz
values.description: Aggressive with 4 Hz (not supported for protocol versions 32.00 and later)

fields.name: period
fields.description: Position update period and search period. Recommended minimum period is 10 s, although the receiver accepts any value bigger than 5 s. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval, otherwise must be set to '0'.

fields.name: onTime
fields.description: Duration of the ON phase, must be smaller than the period. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval, otherwise must be set to '0'.

fields.name: portID
fields.description: Port identifier number (see the integration manual for valid UART port IDs)

bits.name: en
bits.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

bits.name: pin
bits.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

bits.name: thres
bits.description: Threshold: multiplied by 8 bytes for TX ready activation

fields.name: mode
fields.description: A bit mask describing the UART mode

fields.name: inProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which input protocols are active

bits.name: inRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

fields.name: outProtoMask
fields.description: A mask describing which output protocols are active

bits.name: outRtcm3
bits.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

bits.name: extendedTxTimeout
bits.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1.5s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5s regardless of allocated TX memory

messages.name: UBX-CFG-PWR
messages.description: Put receiver in a defined power state

fields.name: state
fields.description:
Enter system state
0x52554E20: GNSS running
0x53544F50: GNSS stopped
0x42434B50: Software backup. USB interface will be disabled, other wakeup source is needed.

fields.name: measRate
fields.description: The elapsed time between GNSS measurements, which defines the rate, e.g. 100 ms => 10 Hz, 1000 ms => 1 Hz, 10000 ms => 0.1 Hz. Measurement rate should be greater than or equal to 25 ms. (Measurement rate should be greater than or equal to 50 ms in protocol versions less than 24).

fields.name: navRate
fields.description: The ratio between the number of measurements and the number of navigation solutions, e.g. 5 means five measurements for every navigation solution. Maximum value is 127. (This parameter is ignored and the navRate is fixed to 1 in protocol versions less than 18).

fields.name: timeRef
fields.description: The time system to which measurements are aligned: 0: UTC time, 1: GPS time, 2: GLONASS time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18), 3: BeiDou time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18), 4: Galileo time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18), 5: NavIC time (not supported in protocol versions less than 29)

values.name: glonass
values.description: GLONASS time (not supported for protocol versions less than 18.00)

values.name: beidou
values.description: BeiDou time (not supported for protocol versions less than 18.00)

values.name: galileo

fields.name: resetMode
fields.description: Reset Type. 0x00 = Hardware reset (watchdog) immediately, 0x01 = Controlled software reset, 0x02 = Controlled software reset (GNSS only), 0x04 = Hardware reset (watchdog) after shutdown, 0x08 = Controlled GNSS stop, 0x09 = Controlled GNSS start

fields.name: lpMode
fields.description:
Low power mode
0: Continuous mode
1: Power save mode
4: Continuous mode
Note that for receivers with protocol versions larger or equal to 14, both Low power mode settings 0 and 4 configure the receiver to Continuous mode.

bits.name: enabled
bits.description: SBAS enabled (1) / disabled (0) - This field is deprecated; use UBX-CFG-GNSS to enable/disable SBAS operation

bits.name: test
bits.description: SBAS testbed: Use data anyhow (1) / Ignore data when in test mode (SBAS msg 0)

bits.name: range
bits.description: Use SBAS GEOs as a ranging source (for navigation)

bits.name: integrity
bits.description: Use SBAS integrity information. If enabled, the receiver will only use GPS satellites for which integrity information is available.

fields.name: maxSBAS
fields.description: Maximum number of SBAS prioritized tracking channels (valid range: 0 - 3) to use (obsolete and superseded by UBX-CFG-GNSS in protocol versions 14+).

fields.name: scanmode2
fields.description: Continuation of scanmode bitmask below (see graphic below)

fields.name: scanmode1
fields.description: Which SBAS PRN numbers to search for (bitmask). If all bits are set to zero, auto-scan (i.e. all valid PRNs) are searched. Every bit corresponds to a PRN number. (see graphic below)

bits.name: senConn
bits.description: Sensor is connected to I2C interface

bits.name: i2cSclPio
bits.description: PIO of the I2C SCL line

bits.name: i2cSdaPio
bits.description: PIO of the I2C SDA line

bits.name: enabled
bits.description: Apply QZSS SLAS DGNSS corrections: Enabled (1) / Disabled (0)

bits.name: test
bits.description: Use QZSS SLAS data when in test mode (SLAS msg 0): Use data anyhow (1) / Ignore data when in Test Mode (0)

bits.name: raim
bits.description: Raim out measurements that are not corrected by QZSS SLAS, if at least 5 measurements are corrected: Enabled (1) / Disabled (0)

fields.name: minGNSSFix
fields.description: Minimum number of GNSS fixes before we commit to use it as a source

fields.name: maxFreqChangeRate
fields.description: Maximum frequency change rate during disciplining. Must not exceed 30ppb/s

fields.name: maxPhaseCorrRate
fields.description: Maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode. For maximum phase correction rate in corrective time pulse mode see maxSlewRate. Note that in coherent time pulse mode phase correction is achieved by intentional frequency offset. Allowing for a high phase correction rate can result in large intentional frequency offset. Must not exceed 100ns/s

fields.name: freqTolerance
fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that frequency is out of tolerance

fields.name: timeTolerance
fields.description: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that time pulse is out of tolerance

fields.name: messageCfg
fields.description: Sync manager message configuration (see graphic below)

bits.name: measInternal
bits.description: 1 = report the estimated offset of the internal oscillator based on the oscillator model

bits.name: measGNSS
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to GNSS

bits.name: measEXTINT0
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT0

bits.name: measEXTINT1
bits.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT1

fields.name: maxSlewRate
fields.description: Maximum slew rate, the maximum time correction that shall be applied between locked pulses in corrective time pulse mode. To have no limit on the slew rate, set the flag disableMaxSlewRate to 1. For maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode see maxPhaseCorrRate.

bits.name: disableInternal
bits.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the internal oscillator

bits.name: disableExternal
bits.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the external oscillator

bits.name: preferenceMode
bits.description: Reference selection preference 0 - best frequency accuracy 1 - best phase accuracy

bits.name: enableGNSS
bits.description: 1 = enable use of GNSS as synchronization source

bits.name: enableEXTINT0
bits.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT0 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableEXTINT1
bits.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT1 as synchronization source

bits.name: enableHostMeasInt
bits.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the internal oscillator as synchronization source Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA0 message.

bits.name: enableHostMeasExt
bits.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the external oscillator as synchronization source Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA0 message.

bits.name: useAnyFix
bits.description: 0 - use over-determined navigation solutions only 1 - use any fix

bits.name: disableMaxSlewRate
bits.description: 0 = use the value in the field maxSlewRate for maximum time correction in corrective time pulse mode 1 = don't use the value in the field maxSlewRate

bits.name: issueFreqWarning
bits.description: 1 = issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when frequency uncertainty exceeds freqTolerance

bits.name: issueTimeWarning
bits.description: 1 = issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when time uncertainty exceeds timeTolerance

bits.name: TPCoherent
bits.description: Control time pulse coherency 0 - Coherent pulses. Time phase offsets will be corrected gradually by varying the GNSS oscillator rate within frequency tolerance limits. There will always be the correct number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. Given tight limits this may take a long time 1 - Non-coherent pulses. In this mode the receiver will correct time phase offsets as quickly as allowed by the specified maximum slew rate, in which case there may not be the expected number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. 2 - Post-initialization coherent pulses. The receiver will run in non-coherent mode as described above until the pulse timing has been corrected and PLL is active on the internal oscillator, but will then switch to coherent pulse mode.

bits.name: disableOffset
bits.description: 1 = disable automatic storage of oscillator offset

bits.name: mode
bits.description: Receiver Mode: 0 Disabled, 1 Survey In, 2 Fixed Mode (true ARP position information required), 3-255 Reserved

bits.name: lla
bits.description: Position is given in LAT/LON/ALT (default is ECEF)

fields.name: ecefXOrLat
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate (or latitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

fields.name: ecefYOrLon
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate (or longitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

fields.name: ecefZOrAlt
fields.description: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate (or altitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

fields.name: ecefXOrLatHP
fields.description: High-precision WGS84 ECEF X coordinate (or latitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF X coordinate in units of cm, or the precise WGS84 ECEF latitude in units of 1e-7 degrees, is given by ecefXOrLat + (ecefXOrLatHP * 1e-2)

fields.name: ecefYOrLonHP
fields.description: High-precision WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate (or longitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate in units of cm, or the precise WGS84 ECEF longitude in units of 1e-7 degrees, is given by ecefYOrLon + (ecefYOrLonHP * 1e-2)

fields.name: ecefZOrAltHP
fields.description: High-precision WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate (or altitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate, or altitude coordinate, in units of cm is given by ecefZOrAlt + (ecefZOrAltHP * 1e-2)

fields.name: freqPeriod
fields.description: Frequency or period time, depending on setting of bit 'isFreq'

fields.name: freqPeriodLock
fields.description: Frequency or period time when locked to GNSS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

fields.name: pulseLenRatio
fields.description: Pulse length or duty cycle, depending on 'isLength'

fields.name: pulseLenRatioLock
fields.description: Pulse length or duty cycle when locked to GNSS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

bits.name: active
bits.description: If set enable time pulse; if pin assigned to another function, other function takes precedence.

bits.name: lockGnssFreq
bits.description: If set, synchronize time pulse to GNSS as soon as GNSS time is valid. If not set, or before GNSS time is valid, use local clock.

bits.name: lockedOtherSet
bits.description: If set the receiver switches between the timepulse settings given by 'freqPeriodLocked' & 'pulseLenLocked' and those given by 'freqPeriod' & 'pulseLen'.

bits.name: isFreq
bits.description: If set 'freqPeriodLock' and 'freqPeriod' are interpreted as frequency, otherwise interpreted as period.

bits.name: isLength
bits.description: If set 'pulseLenRatioLock' and 'pulseLenRatio' interpreted as pulse length, otherwise interpreted as duty cycle.

bits.name: alignToTow
bits.description: Align pulse to top of second (period time must be integer fraction of 1s).

bits.name: polarity
bits.description: Pulse polarity: 0 = falling edge at top of second, 1 = rising edge at top of second.

bits.description: Automatic IMU-mount alignment on/off bit (0: automatic alignment is not running, 1: automatic alignment is running)

bits.name: status
bits.description: Status of the IMU-mount alignment (0: user-defined/fixed angles are used, 1: IMU-mount roll/pitch angles alignment is ongoing, 2: IMU-mount roll/pitch/yaw angles alignment is ongoing, 3: coarse IMU-mount alignment are used, 4: fine IMU-mount alignment are used)

bits.name: tiltAlgError
bits.description: IMU-mount tilt (roll and/or pitch) alignment error (0: no error, 1: error)

bits.name: yawAlgError
bits.description: IMU-mount yaw alignment error (0: no error, 1: error)

bits.name: angleError
bits.description: IMU-mount misalignment Euler angle singularity error (0: no error, 1: error). If this error bit is set, the IMU-mount roll and IMU-mount yaw angles cannot uniquely be defined due to the singularity issue happening with installations mounted with a +/- 90 degrees misalignment around pitch axis. This is also known as the 'gimbal-lock' problem affecting rotations described by Euler angles.

bits.description: 00: Sensor is not calibrated 01: Sensor is calibrating 10/11: Sensor is calibrated Good dead reckoning performance is only possible when all used sensors are calibrated. Depending on the quality of the GNSS signals and the sensor data, the sensors may take a longer time to get calibrated.

fields.description: Delta time due to future leap seconds

fields.name: magI
fields.description: Magnitude of I-part of complex signal, scaled (0 = no signal, 255 = max. magnitude)

fields.name: ofsQ
fields.description: Imbalance of Q-part of complex signal, scaled (-128 = max. negative imbalance, 127 = max. positive imbalance)

fields.name: magQ

fields.name: lowLevCfg

fields.name: agcCnt

bits.name: jammingState
bits.description: Output from jamming/interference monitor (0 = unknown or feature disabled or flag unavailable, 1 = ok - no significant jamming, 2 = warning - interference visible but fix OK, 3 = critical - interference visible and no fix). This flag is deprecated in protocol versions that support UBX-SEC-SIG (version 0x02) and always reported as 0; instead jammingState in UBX-SEC-SIG should be monitored.

fields.name: extension
fields.description: Extended software information strings. A series of nul-terminated strings. Each extension field is 30 characters long and contains varying software information. Not all extension fields may appear. Examples of reported information: the software version string of the underlying ROM (when the receiver's firmware is running from flash), the firmware version, the supported protocol version, the module identifier, the flash information structure (FIS) file information, the supported major GNSS, the supported augmentation systems.

messages.name: UBX-NAV-HPPOSECEF
messages.description: High precision position solution in ECEF

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

fields.name: ecefXHp
fields.description: High precision component of ECEF X coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefX + (ecefXHp * 1e-2).

fields.name: ecefYHp
fields.description: High precision component of ECEF Y coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefY + (ecefYHp * 1e-2).

fields.name: ecefZHp
fields.description: High precision component of ECEF Z coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefZ + (ecefZHp * 1e-2).

bits.name: invalidEcef
bits.description: 1= Invalid ecefX, ecefY, ecefZ, ecefXHp, ecefYHp and ecefZHp

bits.name: invalidLlh
bits.description: 1 = Invalid lon, lat, height, hMSL, lonHp, latHp, heightHp and hMSLHp

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

fields.name: lonHp
fields.description: High precision component of longitude. Must be in the range -99..+99. Precise longitude in deg * 1e-7 = lon + (lonHp * 1e-2).

fields.name: latHp
fields.description: High precision component of latitude. Must be in the range -99..+99. Precise latitude in deg * 1e-7 = lat + (latHp * 1e-2).

fields.name: heightHp
fields.description: High precision component of height above ellipsoid. Must be in the range -9..+9. Precise height in mm = height + (heightHp * 0.1).

fields.name: hMSLHp
fields.description: High precision component of height above mean sea level. Must be in range -9..+9. Precise height in mm = hMSL + (hMSLHp * 0.1)

bits.name: galWnoValid

fields.name: Nt
fields.description: Current date (range: 1-1461), starting at 1 from the 1st Jan of the year indicated by N4 and ending at 1461 at the 31st Dec of the third year after that indicated by N4

bits.name: todValid

bits.name: dateValid

fields.name: fTOW

fields.description: GPS week number of the navigation epoch

fields.name: srcOfCurrLs
fields.description: Information source for the current number of leap seconds. 0: Default (hardcoded in the firmware, can be outdated) 1: Derived from time difference between GPS and GLONASS time 2: GPS 3: SBAS 4: BeiDou 5: Galileo 6: Aided data 7: Configured 8: NavIC 255: Unknown

values.name: default
values.description: Default (hardcoded in firmware, can be outdated)

values.name: gps_glo_diff
values.description: Derived from time difference between GPS and GLONASS time

fields.name: currLs
fields.description: Current number of leap seconds since start of GPS time (Jan 6, 1980). It reflects how much GPS time is ahead of UTC time. Galileo number of leap seconds is the same as GPS. BeiDou number of leap seconds is 14 less than GPS. GLONASS follows UTC time, so no leap seconds.

fields.name: srcOfLsChange
fields.description: Information source for the future leap second event. 0: No source 2: GPS 3: SBAS 4: BeiDou 5: Galileo 6: GLONASS 7: NavIC

fields.name: lsChange
fields.description: Future leap second change if one is scheduled. +1 = positive leap second, -1 = negative leap second, 0 = no future leap second event scheduled or no information available. If the value is 0, then the amount of leap seconds did not change and the event should be ignored.

values.name: no_leap
values.description: no future leap second event scheduled or no information available

fields.name: timeToLsEvent
fields.description: Number of seconds until the next leap second event, or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled. If > 0 event is in the future, = 0 event is now, < 0 event is in the past. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

fields.name: dateOfLsGpsWn
fields.description: GPS week number (WN) of the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

fields.name: dateOfLsGpsDn
fields.description: GPS day of week number (DN) for the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1. (GPS and Galileo DN: from 1 = Sun to 7 = Sat, BeiDou DN: from 0 = Sun to 6 = Sat.)

bits.name: validCurrLs
bits.description: 1 = Valid current number of leap seconds value.

bits.name: validTimeToLsEvent
bits.description: 1 = Valid time to next leap second event or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled.

Clock resets are applied to both phase and code measurements in accordance with the RINEX specification.

fields.description: Required frequency offset or raw output, depending on the flags

fields.name: numMeas
fields.description: Number of measurements in repeated block

fields.name: sourceId
fields.description: Index of source. SMEAS can provide six measurement sources. The first four sourceld values represent measurements made by the receiver and sent to the host. The first of these with a sourceld value of 0 is a measurement of the internal oscillator against the current receiver time-and-frequency estimate. The internal oscillator is being disciplined against that estimate and this result represents the current offset between the actual and desired internal oscillator states. The next three sourceld values represent frequency and time measurements made by the receiver against the internal oscillator. sourceld 1 represents the GNSS-derived frequency and time compared with the internal oscillator frequency and time. sourceld2 give measurements of a signal coming in on EXTINTO. sourceld 3 corresponds to a similar measurement on EXTINT1. The remaining two of these measurements (sourceld 4 and 5) are made by the host and sent to the receiver. A measurement with sourceld 4 is a measurement by the host of the internal oscillator and sourceld 5 indicates a host measurement of the external oscillator.

fields.name: phaseOffset

fields.name: freqOffset
fields.description: Frequency offset, positive if the source frequency is too high, negative if the frequency is too low.
